p: The prevalence of COVID-19 in the community is uncertain as it appears a number of persons may not show symptoms. It would appear that the mortality may be as low as 0.6% ( 5). It is clear that older persons are at a much higher risk of mortality (about 15%) than younger persons ( 5). Persons with comorbidity are at an increased risk. It is suggested that the FRAIL screen is used to detect persons at increased risk ( 6, 7, 8). Persons with hypertension and diabetes mellitus are at increased risk possibly due to alterations in the angiotensin converting enzyme 2 (ACE 2) receptor produced by ACE 1 inhibitors.
